member.summary: Base class for expressive validation attributes.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for expressive validation attribute.
member.param: The logical expression based on which specified condition is computed.
The error message to associate with a validation control.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Func{System.String})
member.summary: Constructor for expressive validation attribute.
member.param: The logical expression based on which specified condition is computed.
The error message accessor, allowing the error message to be provided dynamically.
member.remarks: Allows for providing a resource accessor function that will be used to retrieve the error message. An example would be to have something like, e.g. CustomAttribute() : base( () => MyResources.MyErrorMessage ) {}.

member.summary: Gets the cached validation funcs.

member.summary: Gets the parser.

member.summary: Gets the annotated property type.

member.name: P:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Gets the logical expression based on which specified condition is computed.

member.name: P:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.Priority
member.summary:
Gets or sets the hint, available for any concerned external components, indicating the order in which this attribute should be executed among others of its kind, i.e. .
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the value, as this property getter will throw an exception if the value has not been set.
member.remarks:
Value is optional and not set by default, which means that execution order is undefined.
Lowest value means highest priority.
member.exception: If the getter of this property is invoked when the value has not been explicitly set using the setter.

member.name: P:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.TypeId
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, gets a unique identifier for this .

member.summary: Determines whether the specified , is equal to this instance.
member.param: The to compare with this instance.
member.returns: true if the specified is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.Compile(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses and compiles expression provided to the attribute. Compiled lambda is then cached and used for validation purposes.
member.param: The type of the object to be validated.
Flag indicating whether parsing should be rerun despite the fact compiled lambda already exists.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.FormatErrorMessage(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Formats the error message for user.
member.param: The user-visible name of the required field to include in the formatted message.
The user-visible expression to include in the formatted message.
The anotated field declaring container instance.
member.returns: The localized message to present to the user.
member.remarks: This method interprets custom format specifiers, provided to error message string, for which values or display names of model fields are extracted. Specifiers should be given in braces (curly brackets), i.e. {fieldPath[:indicator]}, e.g. {field}, {field.field:n}. Braces can be escaped by double-braces, i.e. to output a { use {{ and to output a } use }}.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.FormatErrorMessage(System.String,System.String,System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Guid}@)
member.summary: Formats the error message for client (value indicators not resolved - replaced by guids to be dynamically extracted by client-code).
member.param: The user-visible name of the required field to include in the formatted message.
The user-visible expression to include in the formatted message.
The annotated field declaring container type.
The map containing fields names for which values should be extracted by client-side.
member.returns: The localized message to sent to the client-side component.
member.remarks: This method interprets custom format specifiers, provided to error message string, for which values or display names of model fields are extracted. Specifiers should be given in braces (curly brackets), i.e. {fieldPath[:indicator]}, e.g. {field}, {field.field:n}. Braces can be escaped by double-braces, i.e. to output a { use {{ and to output a } use }}.

member.name: M:ExpressiveAnnotations.Attributes.ExpressiveAttribute.GetPriority
member.summary: Gets the value of if it has been set, or null.
member.returns:
When has been set returns the value of that property.
When has not been set returns null.
